verses.roman:
'sādhya'-'sādhana'-tattva śikha iṅhāra sthāne
āmi tata nāhi jāni, iṅho yata jāne

synonyms: sādhya—duty; sādhana—how to execute it; tattva—truth; śikha—learn; iṅhāra sthāne—from him; āmi—I; tata—so much; nāhi jāni—do not know; iṅho—he; yata—as much as; jāne—knows.
translation: "You may learn from him what your duty is and how to discharge it. I do not know as much as he.
